metadata.title: CVE-2020-11655 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - low
metadata.description:
SQLite through 3.31.1 allows attackers to cause a denial of service(segmentation fault) via a malformed window-function query because theAggInfo object's initialization is mishandled.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-11655` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

lemon - 3.31.1-4ubuntu0.1
libsqlite3-0 - 3.31.1-4ubuntu0.1
libsqlite3-tcl - 3.31.1-4ubuntu0.1
sqlite3 - 3.31.1-4ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: sqlite package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
sqlite3 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.31.1-4ubuntu0.1').
